DataElement.preferredName: Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Sexual Medications/Devices Supplement Tried or Currently Use Other Pill to Improve Erection Agent Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of the medication in pill form they have tried other than Viagra or currently use it to improve erections, using a descriptive text field.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Sexual Medications/Devices Supplement Medicine or Device Tried or Currently Used to Improve Erection Drug
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A component of the EPIC designed to assess the use of erectile aids among patients treated for prostate cancer._A question about which medicine or device an individual uses or has used to improve an erection._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite, Sexual Medications/Devices Supplement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A component of the EPIC designed to assess the use of erectile aids among patients treated for prostate cancer.

Concepts.longName: Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite, Sexual Medications/Devices Supplement
Concepts.definition: A component of the EPIC designed to assess the use of erectile aids among patients treated for prostate cancer.

Concepts.longName: Medicine or Device Tried or Currently Used to Improve Erection

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent or drug that has been administered to the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
